title: [Massive] Technology-Enhanced Social Studies Curriculum Redesign: Modeling and Multimedia Integration

context.prior_knowledge: Basic smartphone proficiency and foundational concepts in elementary social studies
context.additional_context: Targets pre-service and social studies teachers, focusing on curriculum redesign in limited-technology environments primarily using smartphones

learning_goals: Learners select one topic between "Democracy" and "Environmental Issues" and produce educational materials (one infographic + one video) using Canva or PPT over four weeks, achieving an average effectiveness score of 4.0 or higher on a 5-point scale from peer evaluations (3 peers) and instructor assessment
Cultivation of the ability to design simulation-based science lessons using modeling software.

Over a four-week intermediate course, learners design one inquiry-based instructional plan in a technology-integrated classroom environment (e.g., digital whiteboards, collaboration tools) and achieve an average achievement score of 4.0 or higher on a 5-point scale from peer evaluations and instructor feedback

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
